title: AP-LS Pets Gallary
text:
The AP-LS Student Committee, on behalf of pet-lovers everywhere, have compiled this glorious gallery of pets for your edification and personal enjoyment.
The pets listed here below are unofficially the Official Pets of the American Psychology-Law Society and they are ALL great pets.






Want to submit YOUR Pet?





Have a pet you want to share? Send us them pics!
Submit a pet

title: About
text:
About this site

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: AP-LS Pet Blog
text:
The AP-LS Student Committee, on behalf of pet-lovers everywhere, have compiled this glorious gallery of pets for your edification and personal enjoyment.
The pets listed here below are unofficially the Official Pets of the American Psychology-Law Society and they are ALL great pets.






Want to submit YOUR Pet?





Have a pet you want to share? Send us them pics!
Submit a pet

title: Mia
text:
My favorite word is ‘outside’ because I love chasing lizards!




Pitbull mix



Trying to be a 65-pound lap dog



Hurdling the coffee table onto the couch while zooming

title: Mia
text:
Bio
We adopted Mia during spring break 2020, so she’s our pandemic pup! She’s the best cuddler, but not a very helpful coworker.

title: Mia
text: Gallery

title: Smokey
text:
Having a bunny means that you will always have a friend to share your banana and eat your homework if necessary.




Mini rex



Commonly found hopping into house plants for extra snacks



Thumping her back feet to communicate

title: Smokey
text:
Bio
Smokey had been abandoned in the woods when I found her on a camping trip. I carried her two miles back to our campsite and she’s been with us ever since. She now enjoys a charmed life. Smokey goes on hops through our garden and feasts on cilantro and kale. She also enjoys an occasional hop through the snow when it gets chilly. Her favorite treat is tortilla chips.

title: Smokey
text: Gallery

title: Stanley Yelnats
text:
“Why give attention to anything else when you could be giving attention to me?”




Miniature Dachshund



Has yet to carry Madam Zeroni up the mountain



Eating speed (it’s terrifying)

title: Stanley Yelnats
text:
Bio
Born in Florida, raised in Vermont, and now a full-time New Yorker, Stanley is always finding new ways to get into trouble. Frequently referred to as ““The Bandit,”” he is constantly trying to steal food and socks. He knows he can get away with it using a combination of insane puppy dog eyes and apologetic cuddles. Instagram: @longman_stan

title: Snowy and Sunny
text:
We love it when we get to dress up for holidays! Here’s a picture of us for Easter.




Cat



The vet recently asked if Ebony is an “indiscriminate eater.” Yes, yes she is. Acorns? Yum! Roadkill? Sure! Is that garbage? I’ll taste it! Andy is older than time and must be respected as such. He resents any suggestion that he could possibly have a bad habit.



Sunny likes to go swimming and enjoys riding in a kayak or on a paddle board. Snowy mostly just sleeps.

title: Snowy and Sunny
text:
Bio
Both cats are from the Humane Society and a very spoiled. We work hard to make sure our cats have good lives.

title: Ginger
text:
“Don’t judge me, you would look mean too if you were always naked in this cold climate!”




Sphynx/Hairless Cat



Scratching my couch rather than the 4 scratching posts available



Knowing when it is exactly 5am and waking me up to be fed

title: Ginger
text:
Bio
Ginger originally hails from British Colombia and moved to Ontario when she was one year old. She lived happily in Ontario until her human got accepted into a PhD program halfway across the country in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. Now, Ginger lives happily with her human in Saskatoon. Ginger does not love that the winters in Saskatoon routinely involve temperatures of -40 but she refuses to wear a sweater. Instead, she settles for snuggling up in blankets and sitting on radiators..

title: Ginger
text: Gallery

title: Andy-Ebony
text:
Said about Ebony: “She’s always at an 11, isn’t she?” (Yes, she is.); Said about Andy: “The force is strong with this one.”




Andy (dachshund); Ebony (rat terrier mix???)



The vet recently asked if Ebony is an “indiscriminate eater.” Yes, yes she is. Acorns? Yum! Roadkill? Sure! Is that garbage? I’ll taste it! Andy is older than time and must be respected as such. He resents any suggestion that he could possibly have a bad habit.



Andy has a unique ability to communicate sarcasm with side-eye. Ebony makes everyone she meets feel special and loved.

title: Andy-Ebony
text:
Bio
Andy was born in rural Nebraska, the runt of the litter and the last to get adopted. Nonetheless, he found a home and he’s brought me comfort and snoozles every day since. Andy rules the house and I’m grateful he lets me stay. Ebony had an unstable childhood. She doesn’t talk much about it. She joined my home when she was around 4, after multiple stints at the local humane society. Now, she brings me high energy, early morning silliness, tons of love, a touch of anxiety, and the occasional outburst of bad manners.

title: Andy-Ebony
text: Gallery

title: Dr. Watson and Sherlock Holmes
text:
Boxer



Watson chews and Holmes barks



Andy has a unique ability to communicate sarcasm with side-eye. Ebony makes everyone she meets feel special and loved.

title: Dr. Watson and Sherlock Holmes
text: Bio

title: Wonton
text:
As an adventure pug I love to climb mountains, go along cross country skiing, and especially run in the ocean surf!




Wonton turns into a dictator when he wants dinner. He resorts to stealing and chewing on shoes.



Despite his small package, Wonton climbs mountains.

title: Wonton
text:
Bio
Wonton was adopted as a surrender as his former owner was experiencing severe cognitive decline. He moved from Texas to Vancouver BC in February 2020 and hit the jackpot with his new owners!

title: Wonton
text: Gallery

title: Zoey
text:
Said about Ebony: “She’s always at an 11, isn’t she?” (Yes, she is.); Said about Andy: “The force is strong with this one.”




Australian Shepherd



Insists on being fed and/or played with at 6:30 am every day



Makes friends with everyone at the dog park

title: Zoey
text:
Bio
Andy was born in rural Nebraska, the runt of the litter and the last to get adopted. Nonetheless, he found a home and he’s brought me comfort and snoozles every day since. Andy rules the house and I’m grateful he lets me stay. Ebony had an unstable childhood. She doesn’t talk much about it. She joined my home when she was around 4, after multiple stints at the local humane society. Now, she brings me high energy, early morning silliness, tons of love, a touch of anxiety, and the occasional outburst of bad manners.

title: Zoey
text: Gallery

title: Reilly
text:
Said about Ebony: “She’s always at an 11, isn’t she?” (Yes, she is.); Said about Andy: “The force is strong with this one.”




Golden Retriver/Cocker Spaniel Mix



She is lazy (like REALLY lazy).



She may be the sweetest, most gentle animal that has ever lived.

title: Reilly
text:
Bio
Reilly is a rescue dog from Northern California. She loves the beach, tennis balls, and any/all types of treats. She spends her time in bed, lounging in the sun, and distracting her humans from work. Quarantine/2020 has been the best year of her life :).

title: Reilly
text: Gallery

title: Charlotte
text:
“Oh, this was your seat? Well, it’s mine now!”




Yorkshire Terrier



When she visits with my sister’s Goldendoodle, Charlotte likes to hang from her tail and take a ride.



She always manages to throw up off the side of things: beds, sofas, chairs, tables…

title: Charlotte
text:
Bio
Charlotte is a southern Belle, and she is not lacking in the sass department. Everyone is always surprised by how small she is–she is only 5 lbs!

title: Charlotte
text: Gallery

title: Metzi
text:
“My person might not be reading your mind, but I am”




Cat



Laying on top of assessments



Study buddy!

title: Metzi
text:
Bio
Metzi completed her MA at the University of Denver along with her person. They are both currently Ph.D. students at Sam Houston State University.

title: Metzi
text: Gallery

title: Shaemus
text:
Shaemus really loves cuddles and attention




Mini schnauzer, chihuahua and terrier mix



Lying on my laptop



He can dance, bow, and play dead

title: Shaemus
text:
Bio
I adopted him from a humane society as a treat for getting into graduate school. I’ve had him for two years and we’ve been best friends since.

title: Shaemus
text: Gallery

title: Charlie Cashew Butter
text:
dacshund



Waking up with the first alarm in the morning



sits to say please

title: Charlie Cashew Butter
text:
Bio
Charlie has a strong love for everyone and everything which is a refreshing attitude in these bleak times. Absolutely loves his canine sister Maddie.

title: Charlie Cashew Butter
text: Gallery

title: Ravioli
text:
I need everyone’s attention at all times!




Ravioli



Also knocking everything over



Knocking everything over

title: Ravioli
text:
Bio
Ravioli is a rescue cat from ACCT Philly and now lives a pampered life full of cuddles and treats!

title: Toulouse
text:
Just bark. Even when nothing is there - just bark.




Great Pyrenees



Shoe eater



Throws toys to herself when playing

title: Toulouse
text:
Bio
Toulouse is a goofy and sassy pup. She has a big personality and loves to be the center of attention. She enjoys going on walks, playing with other dogs at the park, and being a lap dog. She loves to give hugs and provide love when people are feeling sad and upset.

title: Rocky
text:
Fun fact: His birthday is on my half-birthday.




Corgi



Chasing cars (especially the Amazon driver)



Being the best guard dog (despite no formal training)

title: Rocky
text:
Bio
We rescued Rocky in June 2020. To our surprise, he’s a purebred pembroke corgi! He loves to hike, kayak, chase balls, and visit breweries, and he definitely has a Napoleon complex! IG: @thebrindlepembroke

title: Rocky
text: Gallery

title: Sam
text:
Said about Ebony: “She’s always at an 11, isn’t she?” (Yes, she is.); Said about Andy: “The force is strong with this one.”




Domestic Shorthair



Scratching



Fetching rubber bands (covert dog?)

title: Sam
text:
Bio
Sam is a sweet, fun-loving girl who was found on the streets of Philly as a kitten when I was in grad school! I adopted her when she was eight weeks old and she has come with me on my moves and adventures over the last six years. She is so sociable and people friendly that I think she sometimes forgets she is a cat ;-)

title: Sam
text: Gallery

title: Chuleta
text:
At home, Chuleta is the “alpha” and I think she believes I’m her pet. She’s really nervous in public and a vet once told me that I must be “her person” and that she can “be her [alpha] self” around me!




Florida Brown Dog [breeds unknown]



Barking when not given [enough] attention (e.g., when I’m on the phone or in a Zoom)



The ability to become more energetic as she ages!

title: Chuleta
text:
Bio
Chuleta was adopted from a “kill shelter” in Chipley, Florida when I was a grad student at Florida State in 2009. She was a tiny puppy and we had no idea what breed she was or how big she would get. Since her time in Tallahassee, she has moved across the country with me: FL to CA to GA to SC and has been a great travel companion, hiking partner, and all around best friend!!

title: Chuleta
text: Gallery

title: Maury (Momo)
text:
Can we please snuggle? Also I knocked over your books and put my paw in your tea.




Longhair Domestic Cat (rescue)



Opening doors by reaching up and pulling on the handles



“Fin, Noggin, Dude” (from Finding Nemo!)

title: Maury (Momo)
text:
Bio
Momo and his siblings were found in an abandoned trailer in PA. He was the last one left of his litter to be adopted because he was a shy kitten. Now, he’s a mischievous, boisterous, affectionate cat-dressed-as-a-dog that steals everyone’s heart.

title: Maury (Momo)
text: Gallery

title: Milo/Paxton
text:
(Milo) Just throw, don’t take




?invalid meta type:categories



Milo can get a little excited to see people and then puts all his weight on them to make them stay because he loves them so much. Paxton attacks ankles.



Milo is amazing at fetch and can catch anything on one bound. Paxton is very fast and climbs his condo with grace.

title: Milo/Paxton
text:
Bio
Milo moved from LA to Nebraska while I was in graduate school to stay with his Auntie and Uncle who had more space to play and run than his mom (my sister). He just loved it so much he had to stay (for 7 more years). Milo is an exceptionally well-traveled dog - having driven from coast to coast at least twice and spent two weeks living with a truck driver. He loves a good road trip. We adopted Paxton in November 2020 and he is living easy.

title: Milo/Paxton
text: Gallery

title: Billy
text:
The only family member always happy to see me.




Cavalier King Charles Spaniel



Greed



Now, that’s a tough one!

title: Billy
text:
Bio
Sadly, Billy died years ago.

title: Doug
text:
“Excuse me, everyone, but I am very hungry, please help” - my fiance’s impersonation of what Doug’s best man speech will be




He’s a mixture of Australian cattle dog, Anatolian shepherd, great Pyrenees, and a few others (thanks doggy DNA test!)



begging for food, barking at elderly people on their morning walks, doing a terrible job at herding sheep



being hungry 24/7, getting the zoomies, being enormous

title: Doug
text:
Bio
Doug was abandoned at a sheep farm because he was bad at herding sheep. This makes a lot of sense to us, because his personality is not very assertive. He is very sweet, mild-mannered, food motivated, and spoiled rotten.

title: Doug
text: Gallery

title: Shoshanna
text:
Part-time bird scarer, full-time princess




Tabby Cat



She’s very co-dependent and gets sad now that I’m going back to work in person. This means she naps ALL day and is wide awake ALL night.



She likes to scare me in the morning by hiding around the corner and jumping out unexpectedly.

title: Shoshanna
text:
Bio
I got Shoshanna after finishing my master’s degree and was trying to figure out my next steps in life. She was my first cat (I’ve always had a dog) so I was a bit nervous and did so much research about cat behavior before getting her. She’s been a great companion to come home to and gives the best snuggles. She loves to meow loudly at the ceiling during very emotion filled scenes on TV, which keeps me from getting too invested in my shows haha. She’s a sweet but sassy little thing and I couldn’t have picked a better fit if I tried.

title: Shoshanna
text: Gallery

title: Cotto
text:
“I just want all the attention, all the sleep, all the ice cream, none of the boxes.”




Boxer



Head tilting to get what he wants



Knowing exactly when to head tilt to get what he wants

title: Cotto
text:
Bio
We adopted Cotto from a rescue when he was 14 months old. It took a while for him to come out of his shell because he was abused as a puppy. Now that he’s in the quiet country, he’s the greatest, lovingest, quirkiest, stinkiest little tank of a dog there is!

title: Cotto
text: Gallery

title: Boba
text:
Mini Australian Shepherd



Stealing his parent’s socks!



He can jump five feet straight up into the air! And smile for photos.

title: Boba
text:
Bio
Boba is a sweet mini Aussie who loves to smile for photos and is never in a bad mood! We have known him since he was one day old and he has been on many adventures with us.

title: Boba
text: Gallery

title: Honey & Bear
text:
Drool is cool!




Olde English Bulldog



Snore like a freight train



Stinkiest toots in the world

title: Honey & Bear
text:
Bio
Honey and Bear are related, but polar opposites. Honey is the bees knees (it is no surprise her nickname is sweet cheeks). Bear is a teddy but can be a bit grizzly. Nevertheless, we could not bear to be without him. He is our self-appointed guard dog and somehow managed to get the nickname “big boobs”. Honey & Bear are best buds. They love to wrestle outside and bite each other’s wrinkles off. Fighting one bulldog stereotype at a time, Honey & Bear love to hike and have recently picked up agility training. When this choir is asleep, the harmonious snores fill our household like a beautiful symphony.

title: Honey & Bear
text: Gallery

title: Nikita
text:
I’m more like a dog than a cat!!




Tuxedo cat



She likes to attend (and be the center of) all zoom meetings



She likes to jump up on my shoulder from the ground, and then hang out there like a parrot

title: Nikita
text:
Bio
Nikita is a five year old tuxedo cat that has quite the personality! She loves to “talk” and practically narrates everything she does. She loves to be around people, and is the most affectionate cat I have ever met. If she’s not in the window looking for birds, you will find her cuddling with her sister, Nani, or helping out with my research (see pictures).

title: Nikita
text: Gallery

title: Buddy
text:
Did you say something? I am sleeping. And you are not Hope. So no, I don’t think you did.




Miniature Schnauzer



He does not eat food directly from his bowl. Instead, he takes food from his bowl to a carpet (usually the carpet that is the lightest in color and most expensive)and eats it there.



When he was younger and we said “circus dog”, he would get up on his hind legs and turn around three times to claim a treat. Now that he has arthritis in his hips, his talent is sleeping.

title: Buddy
text:
Bio
Buddy was originally my parents’ dog. My daughter, Hope, suggested they name him Buddy because that was my father’s nickname until he was 17 (yes, Buddy Bull). When my parents moved into a senior living community, they asked us to adopt him and he has been with us ever since (9 years). Hope is his favorite person.

title: Gatsby
text:
Said about Ebony: “She’s always at an 11, isn’t she?” (Yes, she is.); Said about Andy: “The force is strong with this one.”




Lab mix



Licking cacti and other sharp objects



Little spoon extraordinaire– always wants to cuddle and never takes up too much space

title: Gatsby
text:
Bio
Andy was born in rural Nebraska, the runt of the litter and the last to get adopted. Nonetheless, he found a home and he’s brought me comfort and snoozles every day since. Andy rules the house and I’m grateful he lets me stay. Ebony had an unstable childhood. She doesn’t talk much about it. She joined my home when she was around 4, after multiple stints at the local humane society. Now, she brings me high energy, early morning silliness, tons of love, a touch of anxiety, and the occasional outburst of bad manners.

title: Gatsby
text: Gallery

title: Fitz
text:
FEED ME - Audrey II




Pitbull Mix



Constantly trying to eat Airpods.



Capable of making incredibly high pitched noises for unfathomable lengths of time.

title: Fitz
text:
Bio
(Leopold) Fitz was born on September 28, 2020. Despite being born into one of the worst years in recent memory; he remains the best of pups. You can follow his early adventures in the bustling town of Lincoln, Nebraska on his instagram

title: Fitz
text: Gallery

title: Mika
text:
“I better warn everyone that the postal worker is gonna kill us all. Every. Single. Day.”




Yorkshire Terrier







Always, always, always ready for a walk

title: Mika
text:
Bio
Nothing exceptional – she’s just the best dog in the world.

title: Mika
text: Gallery

title: Maverick, Bella, and Joey
text:
They’re the three best friends anyone could have and are currently mad mom doesn’t work from home anymore.




Maverick is a min pin mix, Bella is a pit bull, Joey is a lab rat



Maverick growls at his sister when eating, Bella chews up toilet paper when unattended, and Joey chews his cage making this god awful sound if you don’t feed him quick enough!



All three of them can sleep through anything!

title: Maverick, Bella, and Joey
text:
Bio
Maverick was my first dog ever, I rescued him from an overbreeder, he was covered in fleas and ticks when I got him. I rescued Bella from a pit bull fighter as a puppy, she’s the only living dog from that litter. Joey escaped our rat lab and when he was found I couldn’t let them “take him to the farm” so he became part of the family!

title: Maverick, Bella, and Joey
text: Gallery

title: Lily and Liam
text:
Any time is Food Time.




Domestic shorthair cats



Lily: eating so fast she vomits. Liam: eating Lily’s vomit



Lily: boops my nose with her paw when she wants to have her face pet. Liam: feels moved by music and will sit on me if I’m listening to a sad song to make sure I’m OK

title: Lily and Liam
text:
Bio
Lily (blue eyes) and Liam (green eyes) are brother/sister littermates– even though they don’t look very similar! They are pair bonded, which means they love to cuddle and hate being separated. I adopted them as a grad student, so from the beginning they have ben excellent helpers when I analyze data or write.

title: Lily and Liam
text: Gallery

title: Pickle
text:
Have you folks tried throwing up on the carpet?! 10/10 would recommend




Mini Ewok







Being very small. She’s only 4.9lb!

title: Pickle
text:
Bio
Pickle looks more like 1 or 2 years old - people can’t believe she is almost 20. She’s kind of a diva and will only eat (drink?) fancy cat broth these days.

title: Pickle
text: Gallery

title: Atlas
text:
“Small but mighty”




French Bulldog



Loves to dig!



Can sleep for the majority of the day and night

title: Atlas
text:
Bio
Atlas was a puppy in a litter from a friend. I had followed pictures of him on Facebook since he was born. The breed is my dream dog and I never thought I would get one! Christmas of 2022 I was surprised with him and he has been the best dog a dog mum could possibly want!

title: Atlas
text: Gallery

title: Phinneas
text:
“If you’re not going to pay attention to me, I’m going to start yelling”




Shelter cat/ Siamese mix



Eating anything and everything (thanks feline pica), ESPECIALLY moms yarn



Phinneas is an amazing travel companion- he loves going outside, going on car rides, and even flying! When we drove from Wisconsin to El Paso, he only meowed once!

title: Phinneas
text:
Bio
Phinneas was adopted from Green Bay, WI when he was three months old and has been spoiled ever since. He has tons of energy but loves cuddles and napping. He is also very needy and is always within paws reach when mom is studying- he will arguably be smarter than she is by the end of her PhD program with how much he loves her notes and textbooks!

title: Phinneas
text: Gallery

title: Jax
text:
Eating treats, playing, and barking are the best forms of self-care.




Schnorkie (Schnauzer-Yorkie)



Expert escape artist.



Ability to tolerate cold weather.

title: Jax
text:
Bio
Jax was born in Iowa and met Dr. Apryl while she was completing her postdoc in Minnesota. He has now lived in four different states but loves Colorado the most for all of its many dog parks and the frequent snow. Jax has a vibrant personality and loves nearly every animal and human he comes into contact with. He recently celebrated his 8th birthday–He typically celebrates his birthdays by coming to class at DU’s master’s in forensic psychology program and guest lectures on psychopathy.

title: Jax
text: Gallery

title: Smokey and Queenie
text:
You know they are awake at 4am fighting down the hallway.




Andy (dachshund); Ebony (rat terrier mix???)



The vet recently asked if Ebony is an “indiscriminate eater.” Yes, yes she is. Acorns? Yum! Roadkill? Sure! Is that garbage? I’ll taste it! Andy is older than time and must be respected as such. He resents any suggestion that he could possibly have a bad habit.



They love to cuddle and take up space on my side of the bed!

title: Smokey and Queenie
text:
Bio
Smokey (grey and black) is two years old and reminds me so much of a human and “listens” to commands. Queenie (tan and brown) was found when she just walked in the house with her babies behind her. Her babies are with two other families but she never left!

title: Smokey and Queenie
text: Gallery

title: Oli
text:
“You only think you are in charge here!”




Havanese



When on leash, he lunges at other dogs saying “hold me back, hold me back!”



Sleeping (he’s very good at it!)

title: Oli
text:
Bio
Oli has led a charmed life, two doting parents and friends and neighbours who adore him. He is particularly spoiled now that we have both worked from home exclusively since the pandemic began. He is easy-going, fun and affectionate, except when he meets other dogs.

title: Frodo; Blackberry; Katniss; Hansel (aka Tac-o-cat); Gretel
text:
Cats, Long-haired Dachshund & Collie
